metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000205 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: U-Boot contains a CWE-20: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Verified boot signature validation that can result in Bypass verified boot. This attack appear to be exploitable via Specially crafted FIT image and special device memory functionality.

notes.note: mdeslaur> verified boot not used in Ubuntu, setting as "negligible"

criterions.comment: u-boot package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
